results.title: Toil and trouble
results.brief_description: When the warehouse boss lowers the overheads, Bronwen fights back and earns a black belt in Industrial Relations. Produced in the style of the silent era, and performed in mime, this short story also contains a social political message of today’s IR laws in Australia. Music soundtrack with English intertitles. Music by Donna Coleman (pianist), Disasteradio and The Raskolnikovs. Warning: contains coarse language.

results.title: Together in the middle of nowhere
results.creator_credit: Rachel Clements, AFTRS and Tony Krawitz
results.brief_description: When his girlfriend decides to do an extra shift at the stripclub where she works, a young man embarks alone on a surreal, drug-fuelled journey. Their separate experiences over the course of the night leave them both shaken, and with their reunion in the morning comes a heightened awareness of how much they mean to one another. Cast includes Mark Priestley and Haley McElhinney.

results.title: Together = Tillsammans [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Lars Jonsson, Memfis and Lukas Moodysson
results.brief_description: Together is a Swedish comedy written and directed by Lukas Moodysson (Fucking Amal aka Show me love). The setting is Stockholm, 1975, in the maelstrom of the counter culture movement. Elisabeth (Lisa Lindgren), a suburban housewife and mother of two, is leaving her abusive and alcoholic husband, Rolf (Michael Nygvist). Her choice of refuge is her brother’s commune where he is living with numerous adults, several couples and their children. The house is a hotbed of political thought, feminist ideals, sexual freedom and alternative thinking. Moodysson economically and amusingly depicts the tensions within the extended group and the complex, shifting relationships in the commune. The children in “Together” are realistically depicted, in particular Elisabeth’s children, Eva (Emma Samuelsson), a depressed and lonely teen, and Stefan (Sam Kessel), who longs for his father and a return to the nuclear family. Elisabeth’s brother Goran (Gustav Hammarsten) is the lynchpin of the house, a peacekeeper who aims to keep all members of the commune from warring with each other, despite his own woes with his partner, Lena. “Together” is a moving and funny tale of individuals, groups, couples, children, outsiders, swingers, ideologues, families, neighbours and friends. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Today in Britain

results.title: Today and tomorrow: a story of the Middle East
results.creator_credit: Ralph Bond, World Wide Pictures and Robin Carruthers
results.brief_description: This film deals with the impact of World War II on the precarious economies of the Middle East. It discusses the instability of pre-war Middle East, methods used by the Allies to avert famine during the war, and the desirability of continuing such measures in peacetime. Focuses on Egypt, its people and their lifestyles. Narrated by Valentine Dyall and Colin Wills.
